channel.title: Cannot even connect to localhost
channel.description:
Okay, so I was working on my 317 earlier and I was in it perfectly fine under 127.0.0.1 (localhost) and then when I got back on my comp later, I couldnt connect to it.
This was done on a vista laptop. Then I tried it on my vista desktop, and no luck. Then to make see if it was just vista, i tried on my xp desktop and none of the 3 could connect to localhost in a client or in mopar downloadable client or even the webclient! I also tried restoring my laptop back 2 days and still no go.
This is making absolutely no sense to me, or about 10+ other people I have asked about it.
What is going on?!

item.title: Cannot even connect to localhost
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Or in the login class, it says to send the return to something other than 2. That’s another possibility.

Read full topic

item.title: Cannot even connect to localhost
item.dc:creator: @p00n99range p00n99range
item.description:
@p00n99range wrote:

Go into the character files of your source if your using one. Your account may be nulled. Delete it then log in again.

Read full topic

item.title: Cannot even connect to localhost
item.dc:creator: @Telenim Telenim
item.description:
@Telenim wrote:

0.0.0.0 means localhost, so does 127.0.0.1, there will be no difference; use your brain next time.

Read full topic

item.title: Cannot even connect to localhost
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Not like that. I mean in the server, not the client.

Read full topic

item.title: Cannot even connect to localhost
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Ok, see where it says 0.0.0.0? That should be 127.0.0.1, Try to change that.

Read full topic

item.title: Cannot even connect to localhost
item.dc:creator: @Kahl Kahl
item.description:
@Kahl wrote:

I’ve tried disabled the firewall on all 3 computers and still no go.

And command prompt isn’t saying anything,its just in any client it says either error connecting or already logged in.

I don’t get why I could connect before and now I can’t. I really need to get ingame so I can work on my game

Server: Starting HybridScape Server on 0.0.0.0:43594 [11:52:32] Port changed to 43594 [11:52:42] Couldn't open output stream to log file Kahl-20090713.log [11:52:42] [11:52:42] Logging into (Kahl, *****) [11:52:42] Your UID is: 74359810 Server: ClientHandler: Accepted from 127.0.0.1:49553 Registering user kahl with pass ASDFGHJK Server: hybridscape Server (2): Exception! Server: ClientHandler: Client kahl disconnected. [11:52:45] Couldn't open output stream to log file Kahl-20090713.log [11:52:45] [11:52:45] Logging into (Kahl, *****) [11:52:45] Your UID is: 5368969 Server: ClientHandler: Accepted from 127.0.0.1:49554 Did not save for kahl Server: ClientHandler: Client kahl disconnected.

Makes zero sense.

Read full topic

item.title: Cannot even connect to localhost
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Take a screenshot, or post what the cmd prompt says when you run the server.

Read full topic

item.title: Cannot even connect to localhost
item.dc:creator: @fernpow fernpow
item.description:
@fernpow wrote:

it could be a firewall. or the source. like the port or something.
try disabling your firewall and connecting.
if that doesint work which im sure it wont it might just be the source.
like a antileech or something.

Read full topic

item.title: Cannot even connect to localhost
item.dc:creator: @Kahl Kahl
item.description:
@Kahl wrote:

Still, I get the error connecting to server message.

I even setup IIS (Internet Information Services) which allows you to visit http://localhost/ in the web browser. But nope, didnt make a difference.

So strange to me.

Read full topic

item.title: Cannot even connect to localhost
item.dc:creator: @Telenim Telenim
item.description:
@Telenim wrote:

Try localhost then, as the IP.

Read full topic

item.title: Cannot even connect to localhost
item.dc:creator: @Kahl Kahl
item.description:
@Kahl wrote:

what do you mean? Open the run.bat? Yes I know it opens but cant connect to localhost (127.0.0.1)
